meanings.definition: To wait longer than someone else in order to achieve a desired outcome.
meanings.sent1: She decided to outwait her friend for the last piece of cake.
meanings.sent2: I will outwait the competition to secure the best deal.
meanings.sent3: The tortoise tried to outwait the hare in the race.
meanings.sent4: He knew he had to outwait the storm to reach safety.
meanings.sent5: Outwaiting for the perfect moment can lead to success.
